data.name: ConfirmationText
data.value: The default error page setting has been saved.

data.name: ErrorPageInstructions
data.value: Any web page can be used as the default error page. Select the desired page from the site tree control below and click Save.

data.name: ErrorPageLabel
data.value: Specify a URL to use as the default error page

data.name: ErrorPageNotSetError
data.value: A default error page needs to be set in the tree control

data.name: ErrorPageWarningLabel
data.value: The current setting cannot be populated in the tree control because the default error page is not in the application directory:

data.name: Instructions
data.value: You use the default error pages for reporting .aspx errors or you can specify a custom .aspx page to use for error reporting.

data.name: TitleForSite
data.value: Define Default Error Page for site: {0}

data.name: ErrorPageWarningErrorsNotEnabled
data.value: Warning: Custom Errors mode is set to 'Off', set to 'On' to allow the specified custom error page to be returned.
